attributes.comment:
The proposed increases in fees for permanent residency and citizenship are
exhorbitant and serve as huge financial hurdles for the hard-working immigrants of
our nation, many of whom struggle economically under a system that currently
exploits them as cheap labor. The United States of America is a nation of
immigrants, and as such should remove barriers to the civic
integration of the millions of immigrants who support our economy and contribute
to the diversity and cultural richness of our communities. I oppose the proposed
increase in fees, and urge the USCIS to consider other funding sources that do
not penalize and deter immigrants from seeking documentation and further
contributing to our society.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Emily E. Parkey
